item.title: Report X-2024080862
item.description:
Report X-2024080862

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND A LEAKING BOX. WITH FULL PPE ON OPENED BOX AND DISCOVERED ANOTHER BOX INSIDE WITH HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKINGS ON IT (FALMMABLE LIQUID, UN1993). CONTAINED PACKAGE IN A SPILL TRAY AND TRASPORTED BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2024080043
item.description:
Report I-2024080043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-04
  • City: West Palm Beach
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Southwest Airlines F3204 departed Chicago Midway Airport(MDW) in route to Miami International Airport (MIA) but diverted to West Palm Beach Airport(PBI). On final decent into MIA about 25 minutes until landing when we experienced a fire and smoke on board froni a cell phone and power bank. Flight attendants used the on board fire containment bag and safety measures. Aircraft terminated in PBI and passengers were re-accommodated to MIA. Pictures available upon request. SWA FAA PHI David Evans and FAA Hazardous Material Aviation Safety Inspector Santos L Garcia have been provided pictures and information.
